rows.INITIAL CONDITIONS AUDIT: The gate between Danilo building the Trade and anyone else touching it.
Nothing opens until this audit passes. Week 0, steps 2-3.
THE GATE
BEFORE the librarian is hired. BEFORE the conductor sources anyone.
BEFORE a single flash team member sees a single tab.
Caio (or a steward sprint) audits every structural decision in the Trade.
Not the content — the experts grade that later. The STRUCTURE.
The things that, if wrong, would make everything built on top of them wrong.
The audit produces one of two verdicts:
✅ CONFIRMED — Initial conditions are sound. System is safe to open.
❌ FIX FIRST — Here are the specific items that must be corrected before opening.
Once confirmed, this tab is signed and dated. It becomes the foundation certificate.
Everything downstream trusts that these decisions were checked.
WHAT GETS AUDITED

rows.col_3: Is the entity type correct for a DAO? Is the jurisdiction right? Does it support token/equity hybrid? Is the two-company structure (infrastructure + operating) sound?
rows.col_4:
M2 Entity & Legal
S17 Studio Entity
Incorporation tabs I1-I10
rows.col_5:
Lawyer (3-5 hrs)
Someone who has done a DAO before (2-3 hrs)
rows.col_6: Lawyer confirms entity type, jurisdiction, and DAO compatibility. No red flags.

rows.col_3: Does the equity budget add up to 100%? Are flash sprint allocations reasonable? Is the persistent role equity fair? Is there enough room for investor dilution? Does the option pool exist?
rows.col_4:
Flash Teams Model
(equity budget section)
M3 Financial Model
rows.col_5: Someone who has built a cap table (2 hrs)
rows.col_6: Math adds up. Founder retains controlling stake. Investor dilution modeled. No one is over-allocated.

rows.col_3: Does every C-tab have: IP assignment, termination clause, equity vesting, deliverables, time commitment? Is the language enforceable? Are the terms consistent across roles?
rows.col_4:
All C- tabs
(C-M1, C-M5, C-M11, etc.)
rows.col_6: Lawyer approves the C-tab template. All C-tabs use the template. No holes in IP assignment.

rows.col_3: Does every flash contributor assign IP to the entity? Is the language clear? Does it cover AI-generated content? Does it cover work produced with Claude? Are portfolio rights carved out correctly?
rows.col_5: IP lawyer or the same lawyer (1-2 hrs)
rows.col_6: Every person who touches the Trade signs IP assignment. Language covers AI co-production. Portfolio rights clearly defined.

rows.col_3: How are decisions made? Who can change the equity allocation? What happens if someone disputes? What's the dispute resolution? Is there a token or is equity traditional?
rows.col_4:
S5 Studio Governance
M33 Governance & CM
rows.col_5: Someone who has done a DAO (2-3 hrs)
rows.col_6: Governance rules exist and are enforceable. Decision-making process is clear. Dispute resolution defined.

rows.col_3: Does the Directory match the actual tabs? Does every TUP have P-, C-, IP-, V- structural tabs? Are there orphan tabs? Are there missing tabs? Does the Taxonomy match reality?
rows.col_4:
Directory
Taxonomy
Role Rosters
Master Cluster Map
rows.col_6: Directory is accurate. Every TUP has structural tabs. No orphans. No gaps. Taxonomy matches the file.

rows.col_3: Does every role have a clear tab roster? Are the INSTRUCTIONS.md templates complete? Can someone read their instructions and know exactly what to do without asking anyone?
rows.col_4:
Role Rosters
Instructions Spec
Access Model
rows.col_5: None — Caio does this (maybe has one test person try)
rows.col_6: One test person (not Danilo, not Caio) can read the instructions and explain back what they'd do.

rows.col_3: How is equity actually distributed? Is it a SAFE? Token? Paper agreement? What triggers vesting? What happens if someone doesn't finish their sprint?
rows.col_4:
Flash Teams Model
C-tab template
S17 Studio Entity
rows.col_6: Distribution mechanism chosen and documented. Vesting triggers clear. Incomplete sprint policy defined.

rows.col_3: What are the actual costs before any revenue? Domain, hosting, tools, lawyer hours, any contractor minimums. Is there $0 budget or some seed capital? What triggers the first raise?
rows.col_4:
M3 Financial Model
S16 Studio Financial
rows.col_6: All pre-revenue costs identified. Funding source for those costs confirmed. Raise trigger defined.

rows.col_3: Are the platform postings ready? Are the cold email templates written? Are the screening criteria defined? Can the Conductor start sourcing on Day 1?
rows.col_4:
Recruiting Operations
Recruiting Funnel
F7 Cold Email
F8 Platform Recruiting
rows.col_6: Templates exist. Platforms identified. Screening criteria clear. Conductor can start Day 1.

rows.INITIAL CONDITIONS AUDIT: OUTSIDE HELP BUDGET
Lawyer: 8-12 hours total across items 1, 3, 4, 5, 8
OR: find a lawyer who takes equity (0.5-1%) for the full review
DAO-experienced person: 4-6 hours across items 1, 5
Could be a flash sprint: 0.1-0.25% equity for a half-day audit
Cap table person: 2 hours for item 2
Could be the same lawyer or a fractional CFO flash sprint
TOTAL outside help: ~15-20 hours of expert time
COST: $0 if all equity-based, or $3,000-$8,000 if paid
This is the only place where paying cash might be worth it.
Getting the initial conditions wrong is the one mistake you can't flash-sprint your way out of.

WEEK 0 SEQUENCE (updated)
Step 1: Danilo builds the Trade with Claude. (DONE — this file)
Step 2: Caio cleans up the file. Organizes tabs. Confirms Directory accuracy.
Step 3: Caio audits initial conditions (this tab). Brings in lawyer + DAO person.
Step 4: GATE: Audit passes. Sign-off recorded. File is certified.
Step 5: Caio hires Elaine (librarian).
Step 6: Elaine sets up Google Drive. Hires the Conductor.
Step 7: System opens. Flash sprints begin.
Steps 2-4 take 1-2 weeks. Nobody else is involved.
Steps 5-7 take 1 week. Then it's live.
